result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 12 - Defense files motion to substitute judge prior to arraignment

2:39 PM Defendant Bobby D Clayton in court, in custody.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Bobby D Clayton.  Attorney Frank Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. State request counts 1,2 be found transactionally related. Atty Anderson objects and gives argument. State gives argument. Court makes findings and will find the counts 2,3 transactionally related. Witness duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Defendant identified. Cross by Atty Anderson. State moves for bind over, waives argument. Atty Anderson objects to bind over, waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 12.

Defendant Bobby D Clayton in court, in custody.  Attorney Lexi Keyes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn qualifies for SPD; SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. Colloquy w/ defn RE: time limits for a preliminary hearing. Defn wishes to proceed to preliminary hearing pro se. Hearing was not noticed as a preliminary hearing. CT makes findings and finds good cause to extend the time limits and will set for a preliminary hearing. bail cont. State to have witness available.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Bobby D Clayton in court.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. DE is eligible for SPD. Court finds good cause to set another hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bobby D Clayton in court, in custody via Zoom.  Attorney Guy Cardamone in court for Bobby D Clayton. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
